title: 'The culture had gotten really tight': How Penn State unraveled under James Franklin
content: Penn State entered the season with national title aspirations. Six games in, the school fired its coach.

title: Reports: Yankees SS Volpe has shoulder surgery
content: Yankees shortstop Anthony Volpe recently had surgery to repair a partially torn labrum in his left shoulder, according to reports.

title: Kidd noncommittal about keeping Flagg at PG
content: Coach Jason Kidd praised Cooper Flagg's performance as the starting point guard in the Mavs' final two preseason games but stopped short of committing to opening the season with the 18-year-old rookie in that role.

title: Vlad Jr., Springer jolt Jays offense in Game 3 rout
content: The Blue Jays, after losing the first two games of the ALCS at home, tattooed baseballs all over T-Mobile Park in Game 3, smashing five home runs and four doubles in a 13-4 rout of the Mariners to avoid facing an elimination game Thursday.

title: FIFA: U.S. govt determines World Cup city safety
content: The U.S. president has previously spoken about moving World Cup matches away from "dangerous" cities.

title: Coroner: Former champ Hatton died by suicide
content: Former boxing world champion Ricky Hatton was found hanged at his home, a coroner's court heard Thursday.

title: Spirit star Rodman exits in tears, set for scans
content: An emotional Trinity Rodman had to be helped off the field because of an injury in the first half of the Washington Spirit's game with Monterrey on Wednesday.

title: Source: 'Outrage' over surface at Steelers field
content: Players from the Steelers and Browns expressed "outrage" and concerns to the NFLPA about the "embarrassing" playing surface last weekend at Acrisure Stadium, a union source told ESPN.

title: Kings' Murray secures 5-year, $140M extension
content: Kings forward Keegan Murray has agreed to a five-year, $140 million rookie contract extension with the franchise, his representatives told ESPN.

content: Our college football experts provide insight on the Baylor-TCU rivalry, Heisman contenders and more ahead of Week 8.

title: Are the Dodgers unbeatable? Here's how they're unlocking their best selves when it matters most
content: L.A. didn't enter October as the juggernaut it was expected to be. Now, though, the Dodgers are playing like it.

title: Two brothers, second chances and a different kind of Steel Curtain
content: Thanks to his trade to Pittsburgh, tight end Jonnu Smith and his incarcerated brother are closer than ever.

content: Sam Darnold, Justin Fields, Daniel Jones, Aaron Rodgers and Geno Smith all landed with new teams this season. How are things going after six weeks?

content: As an Oct. 20 deadline looms, here's everything you need to know about the biggest potential NBA rookie contract extension decisions that have yet to unfold.

content: In a pivotal offseason, a new CBA is being negotiated and there's an unprecedented number of free agents.

content: Kane has always been an elite goal scorer, but in his third season with Bayern Munich, he has taken his game to a whole new level.

content: Amorim has leaned more on Mount this season, and Mount is showing just what this club has been missing.

content: When Reggie Bush shoved Matt Leinart into the end zone, it saved USC's season and ignited a debate that still lingers.

content: How many QBs could go in Round 1? How high might Rueben Bain Jr. go? Will the Buckeyes run Day 1? Let's project the first 32 picks for April.

content: ESPN MMA experts make their predictions and give betting tips for UFC Fight Night from Vancouver, British Columbia.

content: Tyson Fury said he wants to return to boxing next year, so which opponents should Fury consider and why?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Spurs ready to bring Kane back from Bayern
content: Tottenham Hotspur are willing to pay Harry Kane's ‚Ç¨60 million release clause to re-sign him from Bayern Munich. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Survivor pool strategy: Chiefs, Broncos among top options in Week 7
content: NFL survivor pool strategy, predictions and picks for ESPN Eliminator Challenge Week 7, including teams to pick or save for later.

title: Talent, emotional intelligence and a lifetime of sacrifice have made Oscar Piastri a F1 title favorite
content: There's no doubting Oscar Piastri's talent, but what's set him apart in his F1 title quest is his ability to control his emotions.

title: Experts identify one player they feel differently about compared with common narrative
content: Our experts identify one player they feel differently about compared to the common narrative heading into the NBA season.

title: Russia Unleashes 300 Drones On Ukraine As Zelensky Heads To White House
content: Russia battered Ukraine's energy facilities with hundreds of drones and dozens of missiles in its latest heavy bombardment of the country's power grid, authorities said Thursday.

title: No Phone Call Between PM, Trump Yesterday: India On US President's Oil Claim
content: India on Thursday firmly denied claims made by US President Donald Trump that he had a recent telephonic conversation with Prime Minister Narendra Modi during which, he alleges, the PM "assured" him India would cease purchasing oil from Russia.

title: World War II diary Of Chinese Officer Who Dodged Death Found In Hong Kong
content: The captain of the giant Royal Navy battleship called his officers together to give them a first morsel of one of World War II's most closely guarded secrets: Prepare yourselves, he said, for "an extremely important task."

title: Video: Hospital Staffer Whips Out Gun, Points It At Medical Officer's Head In Madhya Pradesh
content: Angry at allegedly being denied his salary, a hospital employee walked up to a medical officer in Madhya Pradesh's Shivpuri district and pointed a gun at him. A video of the incident has gone viral on social media, sparking outrage and fear.

title: 16 Gujarat Ministers Resign Ahead Of Cabinet Expansion
content: A day ahead of the planned cabinet expansion in Gujarat, all 16 ministers except Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel resigned on Thursday, BJP sources said.

title: Zepto Raises $450 Million At $7 Billion Valuation
content: Quick commerce major Zepto on Thursday said that it has raised USD 450 million (about Rs 3,757.5 crore) in a funding round led by the California Public Employees' Retirement System (CalPERS) at a valuation of USD 7 billion.

title: "Prince Andrew Acted As If Sex With 17-Year-Old Was Birthright": Survivor's Memoir
content: Britain's Prince Andrew behaved as if having sex with the then 17-year-old Virginia Giuffre was his "birthright", according to allegations in her posthumous memoir.

title: Auto Driver Forces Wife To Consume Poison, Dies By Suicide In UP: Cops
content: A 38-year-old auto driver here allegedly forced his wife to consume poison before taking the toxic substance himself due to alleged harassment over unpaid debt, police said on Thursday.

title: The Man Behind Pakistan's Deadly New Enemy, Afghanistan
content: Hanging over the recent eruption of fighting between Pakistan and Afghanistan, the most serious clash between the neighbours in decades, is the spectre of a militant leader Islamabad accuses of directing near-daily attacks on its soil.

title: 'Thrilled, Looking Forward To Meeting PM Modi At NDTV World Summit': Rishi Sunak
content: Britain's former prime minister Rishi Sunak said he is thrilled and looking forward to participating at the NDTV World Summit to be held in Delhi on Friday and Saturday.

title: Cars, Motorcycles, Flats: Companies' Extravagant Diwali Gifts For Employees
content: As India lights up for Diwali in 2025, corporations and businesses - big and small - are offering lavish gifts to employees that combine luxury and surprise this holiday season.

title: 170 Maoists, Including Commander, Surrender In Chhattisgarh; 258 In 2 Days
content: In what was one of the largest Maoist surrenders in recent years, as many as 170 Maoists surrendered in Chhattisgarh today. Among them was Rupesh, the North-Western Sub-Zonal In-Charge and intelligence chief of the Maoist military wing.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Here's Everything That Google's $15 Billion AI Bet Really Brings To India
content: The partnership structure, while involving Indian firms, still concentrates ultimate control in Google's hands. India must ensure that it shapes the intelligence that flows through it, rather than being shaped by it.

title: US Passport Is Out of the Global Top 10 And China Might Be The Reason Why
content: For the first time in the 21st century, the United States has dropped out of the world's top 10 most powerful passports.

title: Kanchha Sherpa, Last Link To Everest's 1st Summit, Dies At 92
content: Kanchha Sherpa was the last surviving member of the 1953 expedition that saw Edmund Hillary and Tenzing Norgay Sherpa become the first to summit the world's highest mountain.

title: Anil Ambani's Aide Sent To Probe Agency ED Custody In Money Laundering Case
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has arrested Ashok Kumar Pal, Executive Director and Chief Financial Officer of Reliance Power Limited, in connection with a money laundering case linked to an alleged fake bank guarantee of Rs 68 crore.

title: Priest Allegedly Shot At Temple Seer's Driver In Ayodhya Over Parking
content: An alleged shooting incident following a parking altercation at the sacred Hanuman Garhi temple complex in Uttar Pradesh's Ayodhya has sparked concern among seers.

title: In Pics: A Look At Mongolian President's 4-Day Visit To India
content: Mongolian President Khurelsukh Ukhnaa arrived in New Delhi on Monday on a four-day State visit to India during.

title: MK Stalin Urges PM Modi To Raise Fishermen's Issues With Sri Lankan PM
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M K Stalin has written to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, urging him to take up key issues concerning the state's fishermen with the visiting Sri Lankan Prime Minister during her three-day India visit from October 16 to 18.

title: Bones Of One Of World's Oldest Dinosaurs Discovered In Argentina
content: Argentinian scientists have found fossilised bones of one of the world's oldest dinosaur species in the Andes Mountains.

title: Kap's Cafe attacked again: Shots fired at Kapil's eatery in Canada - watch
content: Kapil Sharma's Surrey cafe faced its third shooting incident as gunmen fired multiple shots. The Lawrence Bishnoi gang, through an aide, claimed responsibility, warning the public and threatening further action in Mumbai if their message isn't heeded. Previous attacks also saw the gang taking credit, highlighting a pattern of targeting.

title: 'No call': India rejects Trump's claim of speaking to PM Modi about buying Russian oil
content: External affairs ministry has denied any recent phone call between Prime Minister Modi and US President Trump. This clarification follows Trump's assertion that Modi had promised to halt Russian oil imports. The ministry emphasized that India's energy policy prioritizes national interests and consumer protection through diversified sourcing.

title: MP horror: 4 assault, urinate on Dalit man for opposing illegal mining
content: In Madhya Pradesh's Katni district, a Dalit youth was allegedly assaulted and subjected to casteist abuse by four men, including the village sarpanch's son, after he opposed illegal mining near his farm. The victim claims he was urinated on and threatened. Police have registered a case under the SC/ST Act, and the accused are currently absconding.

title: ‚ÄòParis denounces Shein‚Äô: Mayor slams store launch; workers walk out in protest
content: Chinese fast-fashion giant Shein's first Paris boutique opening on November 1 has ignited widespread protests from French politicians, fashion leaders, and department store employees. Concerns over labor standards and environmental impact have led to walkouts and a petition against the store, while France accelerates legislative efforts to curb fast fashion.

title: Friends over money! Varun‚Äôs heartfelt confession - 'I can‚Äôt wear a Rs 3 lakh watch'
content: Indian spinner Varun Chakravarthy revealed his internal conflict over spending on luxury items, stemming from a middle-class upbringing.  He confessed to feeling immense guilt over purchasing an expensive watch, believing the money could significantly improve others' lives for generations.  Chakravarthy also shared his discomfort wearing high-value items around friends still facing financial struggles, feeling it disrespectful.

title: Introspection mode: Zoho founder to take break; warns of this risk
content: Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu is stepping back from external commitments to focus on coding, a move driven by his principle of practicing what he preaches. He aims to complete crucial product development, including end-to-end encryption for Zoho's Arattai messaging app, a feature designed to enhance user data privacy by storing information solely on devices.

title: 'Double standards': MEA slams UK sanctions on Indian firm; curbs over Russian oil
content: India has strongly rebuffed the UK's new sanctions on Russia's oil sector and Indian firms, asserting its commitment to energy security and warning against "double standards" in global trade. New Delhi reiterated its non-recognition of unilateral sanctions, emphasising the paramount importance of meeting citizens' basic energy needs. The UK's move targeted Russian oil exports and entities, including India's Nayara Energy.

title: Indian student‚Äôs experience: OPT to out-of-status; SEVIS delays add confusion
content: Indian students on F-1 OPT face SEVIS termination issues when H-1B petitions are withdrawn. Even with withdrawal before the start date, SEVIS can auto-terminate F-1 status, leaving students out of status. This highlights the need for careful coordination with DSOs and USCIS for timely record correction to maintain legal standing.

title: 'Get to the bloody gym!': How Kohli made message clear; Shastri recalls incident
content: Former India coach Ravi Shastri lauded Virat Kohli's exceptional fitness and work ethic, stating it significantly elevated fitness standards across Indian cricket. Shastri highlighted Kohli's relentless dedication, exemplified by his rigorous training even after dismissals, which inspired teammates to improve their own physical conditioning and performance.

title: ‚ÄòWe‚Äôre not moral police‚Äô: Altman defends ChatGPT update; backlash builds
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman's recent post teasing relaxed ChatGPT content policies, including for adult themes, has sparked significant online debate. Altman clarified that while adult users will have more freedom, protections for minors and those in mental health crises remain a priority. However, Mark Cuban warned this move could alienate families and damage trust in the platform.

title: ‚ÄòAnaesthesia of death‚Äô: How Bengaluru doctor‚Äôs 'cure' killed his dermatologist wife
content: A Bengaluru surgeon stands accused of murdering his wife, a dermatologist, by administering a fatal anaesthetic overdose. Initially ruled an unnatural death, an autopsy report confirmed the presence of Propofol, transforming the case into a cold-blooded murder investigation. The accused allegedly attempted to conceal his wife's death and prevent an autopsy.

title: AI171 crash: Pilot's father moves SC against 'defective' report; seeks fair probe
content: The father of a pilot involved in the ill-fated Air India flight AI171 crash has approached the Supreme Court seeking a retired judge-monitored probe. The court had previously expressed concerns over the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau's preliminary report, which indicated potential pilot lapses in the tragedy that claimed 260 lives.

title: 'We don't interfere': Moscow on Trump‚Äôs Russian oil claims; calls its supplies vital for India
content: Russian ambassador Denis Alipov on Thursday stated that India's oil import decisions are driven by its national interests, responding to claims by US President Donald Trump. New Delhi has reaffirmed its independent energy sourcing approach, emphasising the importance of Russian oil for its economy and consumer welfare amidst global volatility.

title: Dana White‚Äôs favour for Ronda Rousey resurfaces; fans call it unfair to McGregor
content: UFC President Dana White granted Ronda Rousey a rare media exemption for her 2016 comeback fight, a privilege not even afforded to Conor McGregor. Despite this special treatment, Rousey suffered a swift defeat to Amanda Nunes, marking her final UFC bout. Rumors of a potential 2026 return persist, though unconfirmed.

title: Hack of the Day: How to turn your waitlisted ticket into a confirmed one
content: IRCTC's Vikalp feature, or Alternate Train Accommodation Scheme, offers a solution for passengers with waitlisted tickets. This free opt-in service automatically shifts eligible passengers to confirmed seats on alternate trains departing within 12 hours on the same route. Passengers must remember that modifications are not allowed once reassigned, and cancellation charges apply to confirmed Vikalp tickets.

title: RSS barred in K'taka? Cabinet approves new rules; no activities allowed in public places
content: Karnataka's cabinet has decided to introduce new regulations for Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh activities, including marches and events on government property and public roads.  Information Technology Minister Priyank Kharge stated that permission will be required for such gatherings, emphasizing that organizations cannot operate freely in public spaces. These rules aim to regulate public demonstrations and maintain order.

title: 'Fight not over yet': Netanyahu hints at 'challenges' from Iran; vows to achieve all war objectives
content: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu vowed Israel's Gaza mission continues until all hostages' remains are recovered, declaring the "fight is not over yet." He rejected genocide accusations, calling the October 7th attack the real atrocity. Netanyahu stressed national unity for achieving war objectives and expanding regional peace, while aid deliveries resumed to Gaza.

title: Dramatic twist: In ASI suicide case, FIR names IPS officer's wife
content: Rohtak police registered an FIR for abetment to suicide and criminal conspiracy against four individuals, including the wife and brother-in-law of deceased IPS officer Y Puran Kumar, following ASI Sandeep Kumar Lather's suicide. Lather accused Kumar of corruption in a final video before his death. The FIR was lodged after Haryana CM Nayab Singh Saini assured justice to Lather's family.

title: Kurnool rally: PM Modi hails success of Op Sindoor; unveils projects worth Rs 13k cr
content: Prime Minister Modi launched development projects worth Rs 13,430 crore in Andhra Pradesh, highlighting its emergence as a hub for science, technology, and defence manufacturing. He announced Google's first AI hub in Visakhapatnam and Kurnool becoming India's drone hub, underscoring the state's accelerated progress under visionary leadership.

title: Kohli's viral post: 'Awkward' truth revealed - 'The only time you truly fail'
content: The Indian cricket team arrived in Perth for their ODI series against Australia, with Virat Kohli's cryptic social media post initially sparking speculation about his future. However, the message was revealed to be a brand promotion, shifting focus back to his on-field preparations alongside Rohit Sharma during a training session.

title: 'Will take countersteps': China warns 'bully' US; defends buying Russian oil
content: China defended its "legitimate" Russian oil purchases, accusing the US of "unilateral bullying" and "economic coercion." Beijing warned of countermeasures if its interests are harmed, emphasising national sovereignty. This comes after US President Donald Trump claimed that India would stop buying Russian oil and signalled pressure on China as well.

title: Bihar polls: Yogi flays RJD, Cong for 'big fuss' over burqa
content: The UP CM's remarks came during a rally in Danapur near Patna, held in support of BJP candidate and former Union minister Ram Kripal Yadav, who filed his nomination papers earlier in the day.

title: Ricky Hatton‚Äôs final moments revealed as inquest confirms cause of death
content: Former boxing champion Ricky Hatton was found dead at his Manchester home on September 14, 2025, by his manager. The inquest confirmed his cause of death was hanging. Hatton was preparing for a comeback fight in Dubai, 13 years after his last professional bout. His family last saw him two days prior, reporting he was in good spirits.

title: Stock market: Nifty50 ends above 25,550; BSE Sensex up 860 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, rallied strongly in trade on Thursday. While Nifty50 went above 25,600 intra-day, BSE Sensex soared over 1,000 points during trading hours.

title: Sunlight therapy: A simple morning habit that boosts mood and immunity
content: Morning sunlight exposure significantly boosts mental health and immunity by regulating circadian rhythms and increasing serotonin. This simple habit, involving 10-30 minutes outdoors, also aids vitamin D production, crucial for immune function, and improves sleep quality. Incorporating this practice can lead to enhanced mood, stronger defenses, and better overall vitality.

title: 'Will he put us in jail?' BJP slams Priyank Kharge for RSS remarks; dares action
content: Union minister Shobha Karandlaje defended the RSS against Karnataka minister Priyank Kharge's remarks, calling it an "unshakeable" organisation. Kharge had urged action against government officials attending RSS events and speaking against the Congress government, citing civil service conduct rules. He stated that show-cause notices have been issued and suspensions are imminent for officials violating neutrality rules.

title: Ind vs Pak: Varun takes a dig at Mohsin Naqvi ‚Äì ‚ÄòBas Cup cheen sakte hai‚Äô
content: Mystery spinner Varun Chakravarthy revealed his unique 'coffee cup' celebration after India's Asia Cup victory over Pakistan. Initially planning to sleep with the trophy, he settled for a mug after the team's triumph. Chakravarthy emphasized that the cup's absence didn't diminish their champion status, as India remains the world's number one team.

title: Diwali 2025: Festival calendar, dates, significance and muhurat guide
content: Diwali, the festival of lights, symbolizes the victory of good over evil and knowledge over ignorance. Celebrated over five days starting October 18, 2025, it honors Lord Rama's return and Goddess Lakshmi's blessings. The main Lakshmi Puja occurs on October 20, with specific auspicious timings for prayers.

title: Hijab flashpoints across India: Classrooms to courtrooms; faith vs uniformity
content: From Kerala to Uttar Pradesh, recent hijab-related controversies in Indian schools and colleges have reignited national debate over religious freedom and institutional dress codes. Incidents include students being barred from class, alleged coercion, and police involvement. These cases, spanning Kerala, Jharkhand, Karnataka, and UP, have prompted legal petitions, official inquiries, and public outcry. They highlight the ongoing tension between individual rights and uniform policies, with parents, educators, and authorities responding differently in each instance.

title: From job offer to battlefield: Hyderabad man lured to Russia; forced to fight against Ukraine
content: A 37-year-old Hyderabad man, Mohammed Ahmed, was allegedly defrauded by a job agent and sent to Russia, where he was reportedly drafted into fighting the war against Ukraine. After jumping from an army vehicle to evade combat and injuring his leg, he is now being threatened to fight or face death.

title: When and where Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli will train in Australia
content: India's ODI cricket team has arrived in Australia for a three-match series, featuring stars like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma under new captain Shubman Gill. This marks their first international appearance since the Champions Trophy win. The series begins Sunday in Perth, with subsequent matches in Adelaide and Sydney, followed by a T20 series.

title: 50% US tariffs: Indian refiners look to cut back on Russian crude imports
content: India is reportedly planning to gradually reduce its Russian oil imports, a move influenced by US pressure and tariffs. While refiners await official directives, the government prioritizes stable energy prices and supply security. Discussions are ongoing with the US for enhanced energy cooperation, potentially impacting trade agreements and tariff rates.

title: Now loading! Very poor air: Delhi-NCR AQI worsens within ‚Äòpoor‚Äô category
content: Delhi's air quality worsened to the 'poor' category on Wednesday, with pollution models predicting it will turn 'very poor' before Diwali. Stubble burning's contribution to PM2.5 is expected to rise, accelerating deterioration. Noida breached the 'very poor' mark, recording the country's worst AQI for the day.

title: Veteran singer Balasaraswathi Devi passes away at 97, tributes pour in
content: Veteran actress and playback singer R. Balasaraswathi Devi, a pioneer in Telugu cinema, has passed away at 97. Her career, spanning over 2,000 songs and significant contributions to classical music in films, left an indelible mark. Leaders, including Telangana CM Revanth Reddy and Andhra Pradesh Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan, mourned her loss, acknowledging her irreplaceable contribution to the arts.

title: 'When you decide to give up': Kohli shares vague social media post
content: The Indian cricket team, led by Shubman Gill, arrived in Perth after travel delays for a series against Australia. Virat Kohli posted an inspirational message after the team's arrival, with the upcoming ODI series marking a potential last tour Down Under for him and Rohit Sharma, who have focused solely on ODIs.

title: What is Wanasah Kids? Meet the channel every parent in the Arab world wants on TV
content: Al-Farah & Entertainment Channel launches in 2025 with an updated frequency, offering a full-family viewing experience. Known for its safe and educational content, Wanasah TV, featuring the popular character Lulu, provides engaging "edutainment" for children. The channel is free, broadcasts 24/7, and is easily accessible via satellite.

title: MP shocker: Man shoots, beheads cousin over 'affair' with his wife
content: A shocking incident unfolded in Sagar district where a 28-year-old man was brutally murdered and beheaded by his cousin and family. Suspecting an illicit affair, the attackers allegedly shot and then dismembered the victim. The victim's brother was also shot while attempting to intervene and is in critical condition.

title: 'Cowards': India cricketer slams trolls for going after KBC Junior kid
content: A fifth-grader's appearance on Kaun Banega Crorepati sparked online backlash for his assertive demeanor.  Despite facing criticism, cricketer Varun Chakaravarthy defended the young contestant, calling out online abuse. The incident highlights the pressures on child participants and the harsh realities of social media scrutiny.

title: Ditch these common bathroom mistakes to keep your digestion and gut healthy -
content: Your bathroom habits can impact your gut health. Experts warn that prolonged sitting, straining, and using smartphones can disrupt digestion. Simple changes like reducing toilet time and avoiding distractions can improve gut function. Paying attention to warning signs of gut problems is crucial. Making mindful adjustments promotes long-term digestive wellness.

title: 'Priority to safeguard interests': MEA reacts to Trump's claim on Russian oil; cites 'twin goals'
content: India's external affairs ministry clarified that the nation's oil import policies prioritize consumer interests amidst a volatile energy market. While discussions on deepening energy cooperation with the US are ongoing, New Delhi maintains its strategy of broad-basing and diversifying energy sources to ensure stable prices and secure supplies, a stance reiterated by the MEA spokesperson.

title: When SNL's Colin Jost 'turned up' in Epstein video with Donald Trump
content: In a hilarious twist on current technology, Saturday Night Live's 'Weekend Update' presented a jaw-dropping AI-generated clip that placed Colin Jost at a 1992 soir√©e alongside Donald Trump and Jeffrey Epstein. Using OpenAI's Sora tool, co-host Michael Che presented the unexpected fusion of reality and satire, leaving Jost visibly uneasy about this digital intrusion.

title: Watch: Bengaluru traffic police officer slaps man during routine check
content: A Bengaluru police officer faces suspension following a viral video. The footage shows the officer slapping a motorcyclist during a routine traffic stop. The incident has ignited public outcry on social media. Many are demanding accountability for the alleged abuse of power. An internal inquiry is now underway to investigate the matter thoroughly.

title: What to know ahead of the U.S. Grand Prix at Austin
content: ESPN's Laurence Edmondson lays out the possibility of Max Verstappen making a late run for the drivers' championship . the weekend is set to be hot and sunny with temperatures above 30¬∞C (86¬∞F) Saturday is expected to peak at 34¬∞C, giving the drivers another heat test after Singapore .

title: Viksit Bharat dream will be realised through Viksit Andhra Pradesh, says PM Modi
content: The Prime Minister lays foundation stones and inaugurates several development projects worth ‚Çπ13,430 crore

title: Mill owner arrested for torturing employee
content: The employee, a Tenkasi native, was found with festering wounds. He was rescued by local people after the mill owner assaulted him when he asked for food. Corporation shuts down facility

title: Church pushes back against LDF on aided school appointments
content: Church turns down State government‚Äôs move to extend Supreme Court relaxations granted to NSS managements to other aided schools

title: Study reveals wild crop ancestors as key to restoring soil biodiversity
content: Researchers studied 125 populations representing 10 CWPs collected from their native habitats across diverse global environments; analyses of soil samples revealed that these wild relatives host rich and distinct microbial ecosystems ‚Äî including bacteria, fungi, protists, and invertebrates ‚Äî each finely adapted to their specific environmental conditions

title: Karnataka‚Äôs Shakti scheme boosted economic independence, mobility and employment of women across State, finds survey
content: As per the survey, the Shakti scheme, recorded the highest saturation level among all five guarantees, with 96% of women beneficiaries having used the service

title: Indian iron and steel exporters face highest CBAM levy among EU trade partners
content: Sandberg analysis estimates ‚Ç¨301 million in carbon border charges; India calls CBAM a non-tariff barrier amid ongoing FTA talks

title: Mamata announces construction of Mahakal temple in Siliguri
content: This is the third major project of constructing temples undertaken by the West Bengal government after Jagannath temple in Digha and Durga Angan at Rajarhat

title: Andhra Pradesh puts in place a monitoring system to verify genuineness of every liquor bottle sold
content: G.O. 376 makes it mandatory to verify before sale each bottle at all retail shops,  bars, in-house establishments using a QR code, and entering the results in the Daily Liquor Genuineness Verification Register

title: Bandh in protest against insult to CJI a near success in Vijayapura
content: Shops remain closed, as protest rally is taken out that ends with a public meeting at B.R. Ambedkar Circle

title: Prime accused in Sambhal violence case traced abroad, extradition efforts on
content: The prime accused Sharik Sata, along with his associates, had planned the violence in Sambhal the same day the second survey of Shahi Jama Masjid was conducted on November 24 last year, resulting in the death of four persons and injuries to 29 policemen

title: Making the invisible visible with PUNCH
content: Craig Edward DeForest, Principal Investigator of PUNCH Space Mission, speaks in Thiruvananthapuram. PUNCH, a NASA initiative, is attempting to understand the corona and the solar wind as ‚Äòa single system‚Äô

title: Family donates brain-dead youth‚Äôs organs in Kerala
content: Heart of Thiruvananthapuram youth, who died in a motorbike accident, transplanted into Ponnani native. 25-year-old Amal Babu‚Äôs kidneys and liver too harvested. This was the third deceased donor organ donation to take place in Kerala in the past few weeks

title: ED chargesheet against Elvish Yadav, Fazilpuria over wildlife offence linked money laundering case
content: The ED said he is the "owner and operator" of the YouTube channel 'Elvish Yadav Vlogs' and exercises sole control over uploading and monetisation of the platform

title: ALCS takeaways: Best moments, Game 3 hero from Blue Jays' dominant win
content: the Toronto Blue Jays beat the Mariners 13-4 in game 3 of the American League Championship Series . a barrage of home runs led to a dominant 13-4 victory over the blue Jays . the series leads the series to 2-1 after the blues dropped the first two games at home .

title: Bracketology: Finally, some qualitative data to add to the projections
content: the weekly in-season Bracketology will begin a week into the 2025-26 campaign, on Nov. 11 . the Cougars recently received a procedural advantage that could pay very substantial dividends in March .

title: 2026 class rankings: Missouri makes move with fall signings
content: the 2026 recruiting class remains in the top 25 after the dismissal of James Franklin . programs including Arkansas, UCLA and Oklahoma State have seen their classes fall apart in the wake of coaching changes . with overall success on the field, Missouri is starting to build success on a recruiting trail as well, with multiple commitments in October .

title: Fowler and Graziano: Intel on Eagles and 49ers ahead of Week 7, plus looming trades
content: the "Get Up" crew reacts to the Titans' decision to fire coach Brian Callahan . insiders Jeremy Fowler and Dan Graziano have been making calls to sources around the league . they also checked in on the aftermath of the firing of the coach . the 49ers' seemingly never-ending string of injuries have been reported .

title: AP preseason Top 25 poll reaction: What to know about every team
content: the 2025-26 preseason women's college basketball AP Top 25 poll results are out . the reigning champion UConn Huskies top the list, with the rest of last season's final four -- the UCLA Bruins and Texas Longhorns round out the top four .

title: Vintage duel: Joe Flacco vs. Aaron Rodgers is a historic battle of QBs 40 and older
content: the two starting quarterbacks have a rare opportunity to keep playing at an advanced age . they will be just the second quarterback pairing in the Super Bowl era to start against each other . the two quarterbacks will be the second in the super bowl to start each other as 40-year-ol .

title: WNBA mock draft: Betts, Fudd or Miles at No. 1?
content: the WNBA is negotiating a new collective bargaining agreement with the union . the draft lottery, expansion drafts for Toronto and Portland and a mammoth free agency will have to take place before the 2026 draft . five of our top six selections in this mock were eligible to go in the 2025 draft, but all opted to return for a return trip .

title: 10 players to put on your radar the rest of the season
content: Matt Bowen details why fantasy managers should keep an eye on Pat Bryant . it could be a rarely-used wide receiver making an impact play or a No. 2 tight end finding the end zone . create or join a fantasy basketball league on ESPN. Your championship run starts today! Sign up today!

title: Entire Gujarat cabinet resigns: Expansion on Friday; reshuffle before local polls
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Protests erupt over RSS worker‚Äôs death as allegations surface
content: Democratic Youth Federation of India and Youth Congress workers take out protest marches at Ponkunnam demanding the arrest of those named in the video on Ananthu Aji‚Äôs social media

title: 21st century belongs to India, country to be ‚ÄòViksit Bharat‚Äô by 2047: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi ‚Äúwe saw the might‚Äù of homemade ‚Äúthings‚Äù in Operation Sindoor, the military offensive launched at crossborder terror launchpads in Pakistan, post the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack

title: Zubeen Garg death case: Assam SIT to meet Singapore police officials on October 21
content: The situation in Baksa district‚Äôs Mushalpur, where protestors attacked police vehicles carrying five accused to a Central Jail, has been brought under control

title: Gujarat Ministers submit resignations to CM Patel ahead of Cabinet expansion
content: The move is seen as part of the BJP‚Äôs strategy on promoting young leaders and rewarding performance within its state unit; the swearing-in ceremony will take place at 11.30 a.m. on Friday

title: Karnataka Cabinet moves to restrict RSS activities in government institutions, public spaces
content: Mr. Siddaramaiah had instructed the Chief Secretary¬†to study measures taken by the neighbouring Tamil Nadu government to restrict the activities of the RSS there.

title: ‚ÄòFair, technically robust probe‚Äô: Air India pilot‚Äôs father, Federation of Pilots move SC for judicial inquiry into Ahmedabad crash
content: The petition, filed through AP&J Chambers on October 10, is likely to come up for hearing after Deepavali vacation

title: ‚ÄòThe Pet Detective‚Äô movie review: A moderately funny comic book caper with template characters
content: The screenplay draws on some of the generic elements from comic capers with several parallel events and quirky characters. But, barring some, quite a few characters do not even register due to inadequacies in writing

title: Bihar polls: JD(U) announces candidates for all 101 seats; OBCs, EBCs form major chunk
content: The upper castes (22) also find a sizeable representation, taking their thin population into account, though the share offered to Muslims has triggered speculations whether the JD(U) has now given up on the minority vote

title: The potters of Visakhapatnam: Deepavali traditions live on in Kummari Veedhi
content: In the lanes of Kummari Veedhi, families continue to keep the potter‚Äôs legacy alive, shaping, painting or sourcing deepams that carry the warmth of tradition each Deepavali

title: CM Omar Abdullah requests PM Modi to fulfil promise of restoring Statehood to J&K
content: We were hopeful that the Centre would fulfil its promise to restore statehood (to J-K) in the first year of our government, but it has not happened, says Chief Minister Omar Abdullah

title: India in active dialogue for trade pact with U.S., EU, Oman: Goyal
content: India has implemented trade pacts with Australia, the UAE and EFTA bloc. It has also signed an agreement with the U.K.

title: Dipna Daryanani‚Äôs debut picture book celebrates kindness
content: Author and educator Dipna Daryanani on her debut picture book About the Friend in My Heart, a celebration of empathy, gratitude and the everyday magic of being kind. The first copies of the book will be available at the Vizag Junior Lit Fest

title: At NAM meet, India says any cover-up of terrorism will ‚Äòcome back to bite those who do so‚Äô; reiterates two-state solution to Palestine issue
content: Unfortunately, we have another member state that defends the action of this country, Minister of State (MoS) Kirti Vardhan Singh added, in a veiled reference to Pakistan‚Äôs all-weather ally China

title: Farmers voluntarily offer 40.25 acres for Amaravati under land pooling scheme
content: Following discussions initiated by APCRDA Commissioner K. Kannababu, 22 farmers from Undavalli have offered 12 acres, while 14 farmers from Penumaka have contributed 28.25 acres, say officials

title: Detailed Project Report for regeneration of TP canal in Kochi on the anvil
content: Decision taken at meeting of global funding agencies convened at the initiative of United Nations Environment Programme in Delhi

title: Expect ECI to rectify typographical errors, other mistakes in final Bihar electoral roll: Supreme Court
content: The Bench noted that the electoral roll will be freezed on October 17 in some constituencies, which are going into poll in first phase and on October 20 for those going into poll in second phase.

title: Southwest monsoon gave 8% surplus rains: IMD
content: The IMD attributed the surplus rain to active monsoon conditions supported by frequent western disturbances that enhanced rainfall over the region

title: SC to hear PIL seeking nationwide ban on online gambling masquerading as esports, social games
content: The plea said this unchecked expansion of online gaming has created what they describe as a ‚Äúnational crisis,‚Äù affecting ‚Äúhalf of India‚Äôs population‚Äù

title: Gauhati High Court dismisses lower court order against Rahul Gandhi in defamation case
content: Issuing an order in a criminal revision petition, a single judge Bench of Arun Dev Choudhury set aside the order by the additional sessions judge of Kamrup Metropolitan allowing more witnesses in the defamation case, which was being heard in a trial court

title: Tamil Nadu announces fixed timings and guidelines for bursting crackers during Deepavali
content: Crackers may be burst only between 6 a.m. and 7 a.m., and 7 p.m. and 8 p.m.; citizens encouraged to use green crackers

title: Watch: India‚Äôs wild elephant population declines in first-ever DNA-based census
content: Conducted across vast forest landscapes, the study sheds light on the urgent need to protect habitats and reduce human‚Äìelephant conflict as India remains home to most of the world‚Äôs Asian elephants.

title: T.N. CM Stalin writes to PM Modi urging him to raise fishermen issue with Sri Lanka PM
content: In his letter, Mr. Stalin said the fishing communities of Tamil Nadu continue to face significant hardships due to recurring incidents of harassment, attacks, and arrests by the Sri Lankan Navy

title: PMK founder Ramadoss asks estranged son Anbumani not to use party name, flag
content: Mr. Ramadoss said that even if Mr. Anbumani floated a new party, it would garner no votes, as people would have no faith in it and perceive it as a ‚Äúfake organisation‚Äù¬†

title: Processing time to get Interpol notices issued has significantly come down: CBI Director
content: India has 338 extradition requests pending with various countries, he said, adding that 35 fugitives have been brought to India this year alone

title: Kerala govt to clear two months‚Äô pending wages for handloom workers: Minister P. Rajeeve
content: An expert committee has been appointed for the comprehensive development of the handloom, coir and cashew sectors, which will recommend measures for diversification and modernisation based on its findings, says Minister

title: Zubeen Garg's death: Situation in violence-hit Baksa in Assam under control, say police
content: Security forces have been deployed in and around the Baksa District Jail, where the accused have been lodged, to prevent any violence, an officer said

title: T.N. Assembly passes resolution rejecting Governor‚Äôs remarks on Siddha University Bill
content: The remarks were made against the Constitution and the Rules of Procedure of the Assembly. When a Bill is under consideration, only the members of the Assembly have the right to propose amendments, stated Mr. Stalin.

title: Create special jails for fugitives in every State, cancel passports after red notice: Amit Shah
content: It is not a difficult thing to do with the present technologies. When a red notice is issued, the passport should be cancelled to block the fugitive‚Äôs international travel, says Union Home Minister Amit Shah

title: NCPCR seeks report on alleged ragging of Class 9 student at Delhi Public School, Nacharam
content: According to a complaint, the student was bullied by a group of classmates during a birthday celebration on the school campus

title: Operation Sindoor finest example of self-reliance in defence sector: Rajnath
content: ‚ÄúIt had become a necessity for us to buy defence equipment from abroad, and indigenous production was almost non-existent‚Äù

title: Vellappally¬†Natesan terms protests by Congress and BJP over Sabarimala gold ‚Äòtheft‚Äô row mere politicking
content: SNDP Yogam general secretary says anti-government protests expose Opposition‚Äôs ‚Äòpolitical vulnerabilities‚Äô in crucial election year

title: Northeast monsoon arrives early over Tamil Nadu; heavy rains lash many districts
content: RMC, Chennai, declared the simultaneous exit of the Southwest monsoon from the country and the onset of the Northeast monsoon rainfall over parts of the southern peninsular region, including Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, and Karaikal, on Thursday

title: 42% OBC quota in local body polls: Supreme Court dismisses Telangana's plea against HC order
content: The Supreme Court was hearing Telangana‚Äôs appeal against the High Court‚Äôs order, which had put on hold the State‚Äôs decision to enhance OBC quotas in local body polls

title: Death of Sindhi spiritual leader Sai Chanduram irreparable loss to spiritual world: Yogi Adityanath
content: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi visited the Shiv Shanti Ashram in Lucknow on October 16, to pay his last respects to the revered head priest of the Ashram

title: Arunachal group pushes for Freedom of Religion Act implementation
content: The Arunachal Christian Forum is opposed to the Act, which the Indigenous Faith and Cultural Society of Arunachal Pradesh insists is not against any religion

title: Execution of Indian nurse Nimisha Priya on death row in Yemen stayed, nothing adverse happening, Supreme Court told
content: The Attorney General appearing for the Centre said that Indian nurse Nimisha Priya‚Äôs execution in Yemen for murder is stayed, with a new mediator involved, ensuring no adverse actions

title: Northeast monsoon sets in over Kerala, brings heavy rainfall
content: IMD says northeast monsoon rainfall activity has commenced over Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, Karaikal, coastal Andhra Pradesh, Rayalaseema, south interior Karnataka and Kerala-Mahe region¬†

title: India to host Asia Pacific aircraft accident investigators meet from October 28-31
content: India to host Asia Pacific aircraft accident investigators meeting in 2025, discussing processes, reporting, and safety improvements

title: ED chargesheets Elvish Yadav, Fazilpuriya for wildlife offence linked money laundering case
content: Elvish Yadav has been accused of generating, acquiring, and possessing proceeds of crime worth ‚Çπ84,000 from the monetisation of an ‚Äúoffending‚Äù video uploaded in 2023 that depicted live snakes and an iguana (a protected species of lizard)

title: ‚ÄòNot from backward community‚Äô: Infosys founders Narayana Murthy, Sudha Murty decline to take part in Karnataka caste survey
content: Sudha Murty reportedly said the couple did not want to participate in the survey since they do not belong to any backward community.

title: Grade I constable suspended for extorting money from college students in Neyveli
content: According to the police, Poovaraghavan, a Grade I constable attached to the Neyveli Township police station, had allegedly extorted ‚Çπ1.30 lakh in cash from a few college students who were found smoking

title: Tripura‚Äôs TMP threatens to quit BJP-led coalition government if indigenous people not given rights
content: In the 60-member Tripura Assembly, the BJP has 33 MLAs while TMP has 13, and the Indigenous Peoples Front of Tripura has one legislator

title: Hyderabad paediatrician‚Äôs eight-year long battle leads to FSSAI prohibiting usage of ORS on food products
content: This victory belongs not to one person, but to people‚Äôs power, all the doctors, advocates, moms, and influencers who stood with me, says Dr. Sivaranjani Santosh who persisted with legal campaign

title: Attack on CJI Gavai: Supreme Court cautions against ‚Äòraking up‚Äô incident, to hear contempt plea after Diwali break
content: The Bench, however, observed that CJI Gavai had displayed remarkable ‚Äòmagnanimity‚Äô by choosing to disregard the incident and urging others to follow suit

title: Watch: Nayara oil refinery in Gujarat sanctioned by UK over Russia link
content: The British government has sanctioned Nayara Energy‚Äôs Vadinar refinery in Gujarat, co-owned by Russia‚Äôs Lukoil and Rosneft. The move, part of the U.K.‚Äôs latest sanctions on Moscow, comes just days after Prime Minister Keir Starmer‚Äôs trade mission to India.
